It's the correct answer
PPPoE client configuration on the Dialer Interface
PPPoE server configuration on the Virtual-Template Interface

questions.question_text: From which PPPoE server configuration does a PPPoE client get an IP address?
Which command do you enter to enable an interface to support PPPoE on a client?

comments.content: The exam is different bro they the exact function answer

discussion.content:
It's D
but normally the #pppoe-client dial-pool-number val will automatically enable the cmd #pppoe enable
the question ask how to enable ppoe support only (without any configuration). right answer D. cisco like play with words.
Guys don't confuse yourself. Correct answer is D

The interface can be either configured with the commands as below:
Int f0/0
no ip add
ppoe-client dial-pool-number 1
no shut

B and D are correct. Which one is better ?

Actually, the command "pppoe enable" is auto-generated by the command "pppoe-client dial-pool-number 1". Howerver, it is possible to input the command "pppoe enable" directly from the CLI. Therefore, both options lead to what the question mean. 

Which option is better ? Which is considered as "correct" by Cisco ???

comments.content:
the correct one is #pppoe enable
the practical one is #pppoe-client dial-pool-number val

discussion.content:
interface GigabitEthernet 0/0
 pppoe enable
 pppoe-client dial-pool-number 1
exit

questions.question_text: Which three options are types of slow VLAN connectivity? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Base from Cisco the answers should be:

1. Slow broadcast domain connectivity
2. Slow collision domain connectivity
3. Slow InterVLAN connectivity

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/lan-switching/virtual-lans-vlan-trunking-protocol-vlans-vtp/23637-slow-int-vlan-connect.html#three_causes
I think AEF would be the correct answer

choices.D: Configure the channel-group 1 mode on command on S2.
choices.C: Configure the channel-group 1 mode active command on S2.
choices.B: Configure the channel-group 1 mode desirable command on S2.
choices.A: Configure the channel-group 1 mode auto command on S1.
choices.E: Configure the channel-group 1 mode active command on S1.

discussion.content:
AB is correct
PagP is cisco proprietary and the mode is Auto and Desirable 
LAcP is IEEE standard and the mode Active and Passive
